info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 1:14AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Freezing Fog Developing Across Southside Virginia and Parts of the North Carolina Piedmont... As a result of moist ground and light to calm winds in the general area of Danville, South Boston, and Yanceyville, dense fog has formed during the last few hours. With temperatures well down into the 20s across this region, the fog has become freezing fog. Thus, a thin sheet of frost and/or ice may form on bridges, overpasses, untreated roads and sidewalks. This freezing fog will likely persist through the early morning hours until a drier northwest wind flow reaches this area by daybreak. If you plan to travel in the general area of Danville, South Boston, or Yanceyville early this morning, use extreme caution. Black ice or frost may be found on bridges, overpasses, and untreated roads creating hazardous travel conditions. Reduce speed, leave extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. If the fog becomes more widespread across the region, a Freezing Fog Advisory may be required later this morning.
